DataElement.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Therapeutic Procedure Finished Pharmaceutical Product Clofazimine Occurrence Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The indicator that describes whether or not Clofazimine was completed for treatment of acute graft versus host disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Therapeutic Procedure Finished Pharmaceutical Product Clofazimine Occurrence
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.._(An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process._A pharmaceutical product that has undergone all stages of production and testing, including packaging in its final container and labelling._A phenazine dye with anti-mycobacterial and anti-inflammatory activity. The exact mechanism through which clofazime exerts its effect is unknown.  However, it binds preferentially to mycobacterial DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and cell growth. Clofazimine has a slow bactericidal effect on Mycobacterium leprae and is active against various other Mycobacteria._An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident diseases, and is being studied as a treatment for graft-versus-host disease.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Therapeutic Procedure Acute Graft Versus Host Disease Finished Pharmaceutical Product
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.:A syndrome of immologically mediated tissue damage occurring following allogeneic transplant usually affecting the skin, liver, and gi tract.  Onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.:A pharmaceutical product that has undergone all stages of production and testing, including packaging in its final container and labelling.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

A syndrome of immunologically mediated tissue damage that may occur following an allogeneic transplant, usually affecting the skin, liver, and GI tract. The onset is usually within one hundred days of transplantation or immunologic manipulation.
A pharmaceutical product that has undergone all stages of production and testing, including packaging in its final container and labelling.

Property.preferredDefinition: A phenazine dye with anti-mycobacterial and anti-inflammatory activity. The exact mechanism through which clofazime exerts its effect is unknown.  However, it binds preferentially to mycobacterial DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and cell growth. Clofazimine has a slow bactericidal effect on Mycobacterium leprae and is active against various other Mycobacteria.:Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: A phenazine dye with anti-mycobacterial and anti-inflammatory activities. The exact mechanism through which clofazimine exerts its effect is unknown.  However, it binds preferentially to mycobacterial DNA, thereby inhibiting DNA replication and cell growth. Clofazimine has a slow bactericidal effect on Mycobacterium leprae and is active against various other Mycobacteria.
An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: actions or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process (NCI).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes, no, unknown, not done or not applicable.
